TopicTitle: Cannot rename Vessel by clicking it's control unit' properties

Articles.Content:
Hey there,

In KSP1 you could right-click the capsule or control unit and rename your vessel - I was unable to find the same functionality in KSP2's UI...

In theory you can rename in the tracking station, but in practice you can’t - the name won’t stick. The only way I’ve found to change a vessel’s name is to edit the save file. It would sure be nice if we could rename them by right clicking!
yeah, that is essential - like when you make one model of comm-sat for your constellation and start launching them one by one - you just need to rename them )

+1 for me too. 

Had a separated stage that attained orbit of its own and took the name of the vessel. I destroyed the empty stage and noticed the command pod with Bob in it took on a 'Default 6' name. Can edit Bob's Command Pod in the TS but it won't stay once you leave the TS and there doesn't appear to be the 'right click command pod' option to rename as was in KSP1. 

Not a super big deal in the grand scheme of things...but would seem an easy fix to do.
